item.title: Australia’s Victoria Declares State of Disaster as Fires Rage
item.description: Australia’s southeastern state of Victoria — home to Melbourne — declared a state of disaster on Saturday as firefighters battled three emergency-level wildfires amid extreme heat and dry conditions.

item.title: Venezuela Has the Most Methane-Intensive Oil in the World
item.description: 特朗普政府希望美国企业能帮助委内瑞拉实现石油生产的现代化。然而，这一目标面临诸多障碍，包括该国严重的甲烷泄漏问题。【原文：The Trump administration wants American companies to modernize oil production in Venezuela. There are many roadblocks to that happening, though, including the country’s huge methane problem.】

item.title: 特朗普摧毁气候计划之际，盖茨警告"市场力量"不足以应对
item.description: The billionaire also said the world needs to put more of an emphasis on adapting to global warming as impacts worsen.

item.title: 卫星图像揭示委内瑞拉严重甲烷泄漏问题
item.description:
数据显示，该国老化能源基础设施正泄漏数百万吨甲烷，凸显出恢复生产所需付出的巨大努力。【原文：

Data shows millions of tons of methane spewing from the nation’s decaying energy infrastructure, underscoring how much work is required to revive production.

】

item.title: 风暴戈雷蒂席卷欧洲，狂风肆虐，电力中断
item.description: 风暴戈雷蒂以飓风级别的风力肆虐英法两国，席卷西北欧时造成大范围破坏，导致数十万户家庭断电。【原文：Storm Goretti lashed England and France with hurricane-force winds, causing widespread disruption as it swept through northwest Europe and cut power to hundreds of thousands of homes.】

item.title: 随着补贴政策逐步退坡，中国电动汽车销量增速将在2026年放缓
item.description: 随着政府支持的以旧换新补贴逐步取消，中国今年的新能源汽车零售销量增速将放缓，这将削弱全球最大汽车市场的重要支撑支柱。【原文：China’s retail sales of new-energy vehicles are set to expand at a slower pace this year as government-backed trade-in subsidies are gradually phased out, removing a key pillar of support for the world’s biggest auto market.】

item.title: 印度冬季电力需求逼近酷暑时节水平
item.description: 印度电力需求在12月飙升至季节性峰值，因居民纷纷开启取暖设备以应对席卷全国大部分地区的严寒冬季。【原文：India’s electricity demand spiked in December to a seasonal record as residents switched on heaters to cope with a chilly winter sweeping through most parts of the nation.】

item.title: 风暴戈雷蒂肆虐英国，数万人断电
item.description: 风暴戈雷蒂持续肆虐英国，全国数万民众面临大面积停电、交通中断及学校停课。【原文：Storm Goretti continues to batter the UK with tens of thousands of Britons across the country facing widespread power cuts, travel disruption and school closures.】

item.title: 澳大利亚储能公司Akaysha据称考虑出售股权
item.description: 知情人士透露，随着能源存储需求增长，澳大利亚Akaysha Energy公司正考虑多种融资方案，包括出售大量少数股权。【原文：Australia’s Akaysha Energy Pty is considering options to raise more funds, including selling a significant minority stake, as demand for energy storage grows, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 维多利亚州面临"危险"火灾日，热浪席卷澳大利亚
item.description: 澳大利亚维多利亚州因山火失控蔓延，当局已发布多项疏散令。与此同时，该国人口稠密的东海岸部分地区正遭受热浪侵袭，酷暑难耐。【原文：Authorities have issued several evacuation orders in Australia’s Victoria state as wildfires burn out of control, with parts of the country’s heavily populated east coast sweltering under a heatwave.】

item.title: 国会采取行动，力保环保署能源之星计划免遭特朗普政府削减
item.description:
美国众议院通过了一项预算案，该案否决了削减能源效率计划的提案。

【原文：

The US House approved a budget bill that rejects proposed cuts to the energy efficiency program.

】

item.title: 美国新版膳食指南偏重肉类消费与碳排放
item.description:
倒置的食物金字塔鼓励美国人食用肉类和乳制品以增加蛋白质摄入。【原文：

The inverted food pyramid encourages Americans to eat meat and dairy products for higher protein intake. 

】

item.title: 遏制城市火灾蔓延，始于家门之外
item.description:
洛杉矶野火发生一年后，越来越多的研究揭示了住宅间户外空间的重要性。【原文：

A year after the LA wildfires, growing research is revealing just how essential the outdoor spaces between homes can be.

】

item.title: 特朗普最新气候政策威胁国际组织运作
item.description: 特朗普政府退出两个主要气候组织的决定被称为"送给中国的礼物"，此举将削弱美国的全球地位，并损害世界应对全球变暖的能力。【原文：The Trump administration’s decision to quit two major climate bodies has been labeled “a gift” to China that will diminish the US’s global standing and hurt the world’s ability to fight global warming.】

item.title: 风暴戈雷蒂将席卷欧洲，带来暴雪和狂风
item.description: 一场冬季风暴将于周四深夜至周五席卷北欧地区，带来飓风级别的强风、暴雨和暴雪。【原文：A winter storm is set to lash northern Europe with hurricane-force winds, along with heavy rain and snow as it moves through the region late on Thursday and Friday.】

item.title: 印度国家热电公司物色30处选址 推进新一轮核电扩张计划
item.description: 据知情人士透露，印度国有电力生产商国家热电公司（NTPC Ltd.）正在全国范围内物色至少30个地点，用于建设核电项目，这是该公司扩大清洁能源组合计划的一部分。【原文：India’s state-run power producer NTPC Ltd. is scoping at least 30 locations across the country where it could build nuclear power projects, part of a plan to expand its clean energy portfolio, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 随着食材成本上涨，主厨们开始利用厨余制作160美元的品鉴菜单
item.description: Scraps have never been more valuable, as restaurants use tech and ingenuity to keep edible food out of the bin.

item.title: Norway Drillers to Spend Less in 2026 as Project Pipeline Slows
item.description: 在挪威近海勘探石油和天然气的公司今年将削减约6%的支出，因为少数大型项目即将完工，而新项目的储备量正在减少。【原文：Companies exploring for oil and gas off the Norwegian coast are set to cut spending this year by about 6%, as a handful of major projects near completion and the pipeline of new prospects slows.】

item.title: 清洁能源股因人工智能需求持续上涨，而石油股则表现疲软
item.description: 清洁能源股因人工智能需求前景乐观而延续涨势至2026年，与此同时，油价下跌使石油公司再度面临压力。【原文：Clean-energy stocks are extending their rally into 2026 on optimism over artificial intelligence demand, while oil companies are under renewed pressure as prices dip.】

item.title: 谢尔顿·怀特豪斯谈如何应对美国“化石燃料巨头”
item.description:
罗德岛州参议员向《零》杂志阐述了他认为石油天然气行业如何掌控美国政坛，以及如何打破其桎梏的见解

【原文：

The Rhode Island senator tells Zero why he thinks the oil and gas industry has captured US politics and what to do to break its shackles

】

item.title: 特朗普扩大美国气候政策倒退，退出联合国机构
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普宣布该国将退出包括联合国主要机构及专注气候问题的科学组织在内的旗舰国际组织，此举进一步加剧了美国在全球气候行动合作中的退缩态势。【原文：US President Donald Trump extended his country’s retreat from global cooperation on climate action by announcing the nation would withdraw from flagship international organizations, including the main United Nations and scientific bodies focused on the issue.】

item.title: 中国村民在冬季瑟瑟发抖，因燃气补贴逐步取消
item.description: 中国首都周边的村民正面临严酷的寒冬，由于北京为推行清洁空气行动而取消了旨在减轻取暖费用的地方补贴，许多人无力承担燃气取暖费用。【原文：Villagers near China’s capital are facing a bitter winter, with many unable to afford gas heating after the phaseout of local subsidies intended to relieve the cost of Beijing’s campaign for cleaner air.】

item.title: 澳大利亚一州面临热浪引发的"灾难性"火灾风险
item.description: 澳大利亚正经历自2019至2020年"黑色夏季"丛林大火以来最严重的热浪侵袭，维多利亚州部分地区周五面临灾难性火灾风险。【原文：Australia is bracing for catastrophic fire risk in parts of Victoria on Friday as the country swelters through its worst heat wave since the Black Summer bushfires in the summer of 2019 and 2020.】

item.title: 印度气候活动人士因接受外国资金而受到调查
item.description: 印度当局正在调查一位著名的气候活动家，他涉嫌利用外国资金推动反化石燃料议程。【原文：Indian authorities are investigating a prominent climate activist for allegedly using foreign funds to further an anti-fossil fuel agenda.】

item.title: 洛杉矶大火一年后的模样
item.description: 洛杉矶惨烈的火灾发生一年后，灾后重建开始扎根。房屋正在建设中，至少有一栋已经完工；一些居民仍在为生计而挣扎，投机者正在四处寻找可以开发的土地。【原文：A year after Los Angeles’ tragic fires, recovery is beginning to take root. Houses are under construction — and in at least one case, already finished — some residents are still struggling to make ends meet and speculators are circling for deals on land to develop.】

item.title: 洛杉矶大火一年后，灾后重建成为战场
item.description:
美国历史上损失最惨重的大火造成的损失仍在不断攀升，而关于由谁来买单的争议也在不断升级。【原文：

The price tag for the costliest blazes in US history is still climbing and disputes over who will pay are escalating.

】

item.title: 极地风暴袭击欧洲，阿姆斯特丹机场除冰剂不足
item.description: 大雪和骤降的气温扰乱了整个欧洲的交通和电力系统，阿姆斯特丹史基浦机场的飞机除冰液供应不足。【原文：Amsterdam’s Schiphol Airport is running low on aircraft de-icing fluid, as heavy snow and plunging temperatures disrupt transport and power systems across Europe.】

item.title: 全球最高垂直农场落户进口依赖型新加坡
item.description: 新加坡周三启用了全球最高的垂直农场，该城市国家正努力减少对进口食品的依赖。【原文：Singapore opened the world’s tallest vertical farm on Wednesday, as the city-state tries to reduce its reliance on imported food.】

item.title: 北极严寒笼罩欧洲，旅行和电力紧张加剧
item.description: 一股北极气流笼罩着欧洲，寒冷的天气和强烈的降雪阻断了人们的出行，并导致一些地区停电。【原文：A wave of Arctic air blanketed Europe with frigid weather and intense snowfall, snarling travel and triggering power outages in some areas.】

item.title: 2026 年电动汽车前路坎坷
item.description: 2025 年，汽车制造商在全球范围内售出的电动汽车数量创下历史新高。虽然 2026 年的销量可能会再次增加，但增幅将较小。【原文：Automakers sold a record number of electric vehicles globally in 2025. While sales are likely to once again increase in 2026, the jump will be smaller.】
